intro: Synotis cappa var. cappa, commonly known as the Cape mountain cabbage, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are typically grayish-green in color. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in a dense inflorescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
